subject: Re: Pattern based description of jUnit's swingui?
msgSnippet: ... taught me that ... went out the ... it here. Funny that you mention it but I was actually trying to locate the model-view controller separation. I was
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., "Michael Silverstein" <msilverstein@s...> wrote:
> Not that I know of. My experience extending the framework has
taught me that
> that beyond the basic classes you've already read about, design
went out the
> window. Don't even look for model-view separation. You won't find
it here.

Funny that you mention it but I was actually trying to locate the
model-view
controller separation. I was wondering if the swing gui had fully
segregated
application model <-> domain model <-> view <-> controller layers.

> What did you have in mind?

Well, I'm working on a translation of jUnit into AppleScript.

I've managed to translate a good deal of the basic functionality as
far as the
textui Runner is concerned and was considering tackling the GUI
translation
shortly.

However, I'm having difficulty trying to get a sense of the intent
behind the
various classes in the swing gui. i.e.- not so much the how or the
"what it does"
but the why.

The class and method names give vague hints as to what the possible
reasoning
might be behind the swing gui design but it's still rather cloudy for
me. I was
hoping that there was sort of pattern based description out there
that would
help clear things up.

Thanks,

Anthony
